div.p: Important collector of autograph manuscripts, and industrialist, living in Dessau, Germany.

Carl Meinert possessed several Beethoven autographs (today in the Beethovenhaus, Bonn), e.g. Op. 27/2 (the "Moonlight" Sonata, of which Schenker published a facsimile in 1921), and Op. 101 (of which Schenker produced an edition with elucidations in 1920), and also autographs of Schubert's Schwanengesang and Winterreise.

div.head: Correspondence
div.p: No correspondence between Carl Meinert and Schenker is known to survive, but Meinert is several times mentioned in Schenker correspondence (e. g. WSLB 191.579, June 25, 1913, to Otto Erich Deutsch; WSLB 210, May 2, 1914, to Emil Hertzka; OC B/176, November 18, 1913, from Alfred Kopfermann to Schenker).
Two letters from Max Meinert, Carl Meinert's brother and heir, to Schenker do, however, survive.
